revised_title: Discovery of a Novel GABA<sub>B</sub> Antagonist Effective on Endocrine Cells
tldr: The study reveals the novel GABA<sub>B</sub> antagonist CGP 35-348 as the first compound effective on endocrine cells. The researchers found that CGP 35-348 completely suppressed the secretory response to baclofen, a GABAB agonist, in rat and toad pituitary melanotrophs. This discovery provides a new tool to analyze responses to GABA and its physiological involvement in endocrine cells.
